description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bolhr","text":"The immunohistochemistry (IHC) protocol is used to showcase the location of specific proteins in relation to the arquitecture of the tissue. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"330tp","text":"In this method, we use a primary antibody which binds to a specific antigen in the protein of interest. This antibody has a specific host and can be ready to use or undiluted. The secondary antibody is an anti-host IgG which will bind to the primary antibody 1. It's also conjugated with an Horseradish Peroxidase (HRP).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":259,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkaif","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3muvh","text":"The HRP will react with the Hydrogen Peroxide in the substract of the DAB solution, oxidizing the DAB, creating a brown deposit on the location of the protein of interest.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dvhnh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vpdn","text":"Depending on location of the protein, we can have staining in the nuclei, the cytoplasm or the cellular membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"868q7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhto2","text":"Possible variables are:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b46nj","text":"the concentration of the antibody;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sgma","text":"type of antigen retrieval;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ou95","text":"the pH of the antigen retrieval solution (for Heat Induced Epitope Retrieval (HIER));","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lrtk","text":"the time of incubation;","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e52ap","text":"the tissue used 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6c69o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ju0","text":"You can use this protocol for Formalin-Fixed Paraffin-Embedded samples (FFPE) and Fixed Frozen samples (Gelatin and OCT).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
